• Modular Design:
    • The system is heavily interface-driven.
    • Widgets are decomposed into reusable elements to unify style and logic across different screens.
• GameMode Logic: The BP_GM_CSD GameMode handles the management of on-screen widgets (creation, removal, and updates) .
• Player Controller: The PC_CSD manages current character data and fetch logic (Next/Previous).
• Copy/Migrate the entire CharacterSelectionSystem folder to your project.
• Create data assets for your characters (DA_PDA_CD_xyz) and add them to the master list DA_PDA_CSD.
• Switch your GameMode to BP_GM_CharacterSelection (or copy its logic if using a custom GM).
• Switch your PlayerController to BP_PC_CharacterSelection (or implement the fetch logic/interfaces in your own).

value: • Widget Architecture: Screens are simplified by reusable Widget Elements (prefixed with E_).
• Emotes: Characters now play emote animations during the selection process.
• Bidirection Circular Selection List:
<ul><li>Circular List means if the player is at first selectable character and clicks the PreviousCharacterButton, they will traverse the selection list in reverse order.
• Similarly, if they are at the last selectable character and click the NextCharacterButton, they will reach the starting of list again.
<li>If CircularList is False, then the players cannot go to last character from first character and vice versa.
• Get Previous and Next Character buttons are also enabled/disabled accordingly.

• Quality of Life:
    • Fixed camera rotation during gameplay
    • Fixed cursor visibility issues.
Create a new Data Asset derived from PDA_CharacterData for each character.
• Name: Appears as an attribute on the right side.
• Description: Flavor text displayed on the lower left.
• Icon: Thumbnail image or game logo.
Derived from PDA_CharacterSelectionData.
This contains an array of character data assets.
The order in this array determines the order in the selection menu.
• CharacterData: takes the DA_CharacterSelectionData as input.
• It contains the list of characters available for play.
• The order of characters in this list is the same order in which the characters will appear in the game.
• CurrentCharacterData: takes as input the data of the first character available in the Character Data list.
• CircularList: determines if or not character selection system is linear.
• Circular List means if the player is at first selectable character and clicks the PreviousCharacterButton, they will traverse the selection list in reverse order.
• Similarly if they are last selectable character and click the NextCharacterButton, they will reach the starting of list again.
• If CircularList is False, then the players cannot go to last character from first character and vice versa.

The system uses BPI_PlayerInterface across multiple classes:
  • Widget: Receives messages to disable buttons.
• GameMode: Handles construction/deconstruction of widgets.
• PlayerController: Fetches character data.
• Character: Receives input availability messages.
Ensure your blueprint inherits from the standard Character class and implements BPI_PlayerInterface.
• Add the BPC_PlayerAttributes component to store dummy data (NickName, Strength, Rating) for UI display.
• Emotes: contains an array of emote montages that plays on the player character randomly on selection screen.
• Waiting Time Before Next Emote: this is the amount of the current player character waits once an emote montage a complete before playing a new one.

• Montage Blend Out Time: When gameplay is started, but the character is still playing an emote montage, then this much time is used for smoothly blending out the animation instead of abruptly stopping it. Also it feels weird when you want to play the game but the character won't stop emoting :)

Q: Why can't I edit the child widgets in the details panel?
A: Child widgets added to Frames during Pre-Construct (for live preview) become locked. To edit them, remove them from the slot, compile, make your changes, and add them back.

Q: Can I use my own Main Menu?
A: Yes. The included Main Menu is a sample. You can integrate the selection screen into your own menu by implementing the BPI_MainMenuInterface in your manager class.

Q: How do I change the character attributes displayed?
A: The attributes (Price, Strength, Rating) are dummy data stored in the BPC_PlayerAttributes component. You can modify these variables in the component to suit your game's needs.
